etymologies: mid 19th century: from French, from Spanish carapacho, of unknown origin

definitions: the hard upper shell of a tortoise, crustacean, or arachnid

examples.text: the study found oil in the carapace of 29 sea turtles that returned to feed in the spill area

shortDefinitions: hard upper shell of tortoise or arachnid

definitions: something regarded as a protective or defensive covering

examples.text: under her carapace of self-confidence she was very sensitive to criticism
I don't blame him for building a carapace around his true self
